channel.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
channel.description: Guys, I installed LAMPP on Kubuntu, but I stuffed quite a bit up and would just like to reinstall everything and start fresh, but I cannot work out how to uninstall LAMPP...

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ah, I see. Thanks Rictoo and Mopar.

Read full topic

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Rictoo:

Remove apache2, php5, mysql 5, and phpmyadmin individually.

Do what Rictoo says, LAMPP is not a package, it is short for Apache, mysql, php etc etc. So open up your package manager and purge each one. (purge removes the packages and the configuration files)

Read full topic

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Reinstall LAMPP using the Synaptic Package Manager, and then Remove it with Synaptic.

Read full topic

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Use tasksel

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?

@Rictoo wrote:

Remove apache2, php5, mysql 5, and phpmyadmin individually.

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:4, topic:239022”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=315264.msg2505821#msg2505821 date=1224907776]

sudo apt-get --purge remove LAMPP

I’m pretty sure that should work, assuming there’s a package called LAMPP (I don’t recall the specific names, but if there’s not, replace LAMPP with the names of the packages you installed and want to remove).

I tried all of that, and it did not work
[/quote]

Does it give any output when you execute the command? Also, have you tried removing it with Kubuntu’s graphical package manager interface (I can’t remember the name)?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 24, 2008, 11:18:39 pm[/size][hr]I’ve got to leave for the night soon, but you could also try [tt]sudo dpkg --purge [/tt][/quote]
Yes, I have tried to remove it with Synaptic, and all it says is cannot find the package:

[quote]Password:
Reading package lists… Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information… Done
E: Couldn’t find package LAMPP

Read full topic

item.title: Completely remove LAMPP?
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:3, topic:239022”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=315264.msg2505813#msg2505813 date=1224907402]
sudo apt-get --purge remove LAMPP

I’m pretty sure that should work, assuming there’s a package called LAMPP (I don’t recall the specific names, but if there’s not, replace LAMPP with the names of the packages you installed and want to remove).
[/quote]
I tried all of that, and it did not work [/quote]

Does it give any output when you execute the command? Also, have you tried removing it with Kubuntu’s graphical package manager interface (I can’t remember the name)?
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 24, 2008, 11:18:39 pm[/size][hr]I’ve got to leave for the night soon, but you could also try [tt]sudo dpkg --purge [/tt]

Read full topic
